message.content:
cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.NE

Reasoning: The paper deals with consensus in distributed systems, which falls under the category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC). The use of the \pull\ communication model and the complete graph suggests that Information Theory (cs.IT) may also be relevant. The analysis of the symmetry-breaking phase and the use of probability arguments suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the mention of convergence towards the initial majority color suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE).
